title: Leeds man driven to brink of suicide encourages others in BME community to seek help | Calendar - ITV News
text:
20 February 2017 at 6:00pm Leeds man driven to brink of suicide encourages others in BME community to seek help 
A man from Leeds has told Calendar how he was driven to the brink of suicide despite a steady job and loving family â€“ in the hope that it will encourage others from the black community to seek help. 
Nestfield Lopez, a barber and DJ, said he buried his mental health issues because of worries he would be seen as weak by family and friends. 
Figures show people from black and ethnic minority backgrounds are more likely to be diagnosed with mental health problems than their white counterparts, with black people three to five times more likely to be diagnosed with severe mental illnesses. 
Mr Lopez eventually sought help from the Black Health Initiative and says he now feels stronger than ever. 
Here's Tina Gelder's report:
